description: Number of distinct primes dividing phi(n).
comments: Murty and Murty show that the normal order of a(n) is (log log n)^2/2, that is, sum_{1 <= k <= n} a(k) ~ n/2 * (log log n)^2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 13 2013
references: M. Ram Murty and V. Kumar Murty, Prime divisors of Fourier coefficients of modular forms, Duke Math. J. 51:1 (1984), pp. 57-76.
links: Enrique PÃ©rez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 11 2000
